name: Alexandra Chen
summary: Senior software engineer with 8+ years of experience building scalable distributed systems and leading cross-functional teams. Proven track record of delivering high-impact projects from architecture through production deployment. Passionate about developer experience, system reliability, and mentoring the next generation of engineers.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
responsibilities: Architected and led migration from monolithic Rails application to event-driven microservices, reducing deployment time by 75% and enabling independent team scaling
Designed real-time analytics pipeline using Kafka and ClickHouse processing 2M+ events/day with sub-second query latency
Mentored 5 junior engineers through structured 1:1s and code review, with 3 promoted to mid-level within 18 months

jobs.title: Software Engineer
responsibilities: Built customer-facing REST and GraphQL APIs serving 50K+ requests/minute with 99.9% uptime SLA
Implemented CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions and Terraform, reducing release cycles from weekly to daily
Led database optimization initiative, reducing average query time by 60% across 12 high-traffic endpoints

children.content: AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS), Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform

achievements: Reduced infrastructure costs by 40% ($180K annual savings) through auto-scaling optimization and reserved instance strategy
Open-source contributor to Apache Kafka client library — 3 merged PRs improving consumer group rebalancing
Speaker at SF Python Meetup 2023 on "Building Resilient Event-Driven Architectures"
Received company-wide Engineering Excellence Award (2023) for analytics pipeline project

education.degree: B.S. Computer Science, Magna Cum Laude
